title: Public transport for the A-League Men Grand Final – Melbourne City FC v Melbourne Victory: Saturday 31 May 2025
articleContent:
Experience the excitement of the 2024-25 A-League Men Grand Final at AAMI Park, as Melbourne City FC takes on Melbourne Victory at AAMI Park. Public transport is your best way to enjoy the action.

Extra services will help you get home from AAMI Park on Saturday 31 May 2025.

Kick-off is at 7:40 pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Passengers on the Hurstbridge line, please note, buses replace trains between Clifton Hill and Eltham stations.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Ringwood - leaving at 10:02 pm and 10:12 pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 9:58 pm and 10:09 pm from Platform 10
  • Frankston – leaving at 9:57 pm and 10:17 pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 9:57 pm and 10:15 pm from Platform 2
  • Dandenong - leaving at 10:05 pm and 10:26 pm from Platform 6

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70 

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station
  • Coaches replace trains on parts of the Ballarat, Ararat and Maryborough
